name: aquatic-panda

procedures: T1003.001::[Aquatic Panda] has attempted to harvest credentials through LSASS memory dumping.
T1007::[Aquatic Panda] has attempted to discover services for third party EDR products.
T1027.010::[Aquatic Panda] has encoded PowerShell commands in Base64.
T1059.001::[Aquatic Panda] has downloaded additional scripts and executed Base64 encoded commands in PowerShell.
T1059.003::[Aquatic Panda] has attempted and failed to run Bash commands on a Windows host by passing them to cmd /C.
T1070.004::[Aquatic Panda] has deleted malicious executables from compromised machines.
T1082::[Aquatic Panda] has used native OS commands to understand privilege levels and system details.
T1105::[Aquatic Panda] has downloaded additional malware onto compromised hosts.
T1518.001::[Aquatic Panda] has attempted to discover third party endpoint detection and response (EDR) tools on compromised systems.
T1560.001::[Aquatic Panda] has used WinRAR to compress memory dumps prior to exfiltration.
T1562.001::[Aquatic Panda] has attempted to stop endpoint detection and response (EDR) tools on compromised systems.
T1574.001::[Aquatic Panda] has used DLL search-order hijacking to load `exe`, `dll`, and `dat` files into memory.
T1588.001::[Aquatic Panda] has acquired and used [njRAT] in its operations.
T1588.002::[Aquatic Panda] has acquired and used [Cobalt Strike] in its operations.
T1595.002::[Aquatic Panda] has used publicly accessible DNS logging services to identify servers vulnerable to Log4j (CVE 2021-44228).

description: [Aquatic Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0143) is a suspected China-based threat group with a dual mission of intelligence collection and industrial espionage. Active since at least May 2020, [Aquatic Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0143) has primarily targeted entities in the telecommunications, technology, and government sectors.(Citation: CrowdStrike AQUATIC PANDA December 2021)
